title: A feeding Veigar with little to no income manages to land two out of four of his abilities...
body:
...and one-shots me.

What am I doing wrong? What can I do to no longer be one-shot by Veigars that don't have the items it takes for any other champion to one-shot me with only 2 abilities?

Step 1:
Build MR items.

Step 2:
Pray to something that he doesn't eventually gain enough gold for MP.

replies.body:
Step 3: Actually dodge his abilities. 

 One is a skillshot, one is a delayed AOE, and the other is a stunning field with a large gap in the center. His only point and click ability doesn't have enough base power on it's own to one shot you, the only way that'll happen is if you're low health near him. 

Veigar is like Nasus, his score doesn't matter as long as he farms efficiently and stacks up. He's meant to be a threat mid-late game, which is why you focus him or save your defensive options for him.

Edit: made this comment 2 hours ago, still waiting

If you dodged, why u stunned?
And THAT is terrible champ design. His most powerful ability has no reliable counterplay. And just so you know, there isn't a single person on this planet who has dodged every skillshot sent to them.

>And THAT is terrible champ design. His most powerful ability has no reliable counterplay.

 Build MR, stay at relatively high HP (60-70%+ is a safe bet except for extreme cases), and save your defensive abilities (such as Zhonyas' or Heal/Barrier) for when he's near you. 

He's a heavy burst mage, that is how you fight heavy burst mages. Same applies for champions like Leblanc, Brand, Ahri, so on and so forth.

>And just so you know, there isn't a single person on this planet who has dodged every skillshot sent to them.

You right, because that's literally the situation. Are you going to tell literally every player "Hey you got one shot because you don't know how to dodge"? Because that's what you're doing. You're telling even someone who could dodge 99.9% of Veigar's abilities that because he didn't dodge one, he's bad.

Except if you did dodge everything except for his ultimate, he's not going to kill you. His ultimate is an execute, and is 100% dependent on him landing more damage on his opponents before it can murder them on the spot.
ANd so we return to the OP, where I mention dodging half his kit and being hit by 2 abilities.

If he hits you with his E, he can't kill you with his ultimate without damaging you before that. Which means you'd need to be hit by more than 2 abilities. 

If he hits you with his Q, you are not incapacitated, and are free to flash and or run out of his range for his W and R. If he's in a spot where he can combo you with Q and R, you are not respecting his damage output.

If he hits you with his W, that's all on you. It has a long as hell cast time, and it's telegraphed. This would mean you sat in the same place long enough for him to land that much damage on you and you're not reacting to what he's doing. 

If he for whatever reason has an aneurysm and opens with R and follows with something else, he's not one shotting you.

Veigars range is actually fairly short, with his Q being his longest range spell. There's not really many reasons why you shouldn't be able to play around him for the majority of the lane, unless you're making a lot of mistakes he's capitalizing on. He really thrives in the madness of a team fight, which shouldn't be occurring often in mid lane, so again, it's poor positioning if you're dying constantly to an underfed, bullied Veigar in lane.

Well, I didn't say "constantly", just that it happens. And it can happen, at any point after level what...9? If you just happen to not be paying attention and a comet just happens to fall on you, he presses R and you're dead or at the very least very low. From full. It happens.
Veigar has counterplay, but the amount of effort and skill it takes to play against him is always exponentially higher than the amount it takes to play as him. Outdated champ design.
